main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the computer behind the game. It waits for user inputs, next checks the move and does it if it is valid. But if not, it also undoes the turn and asks the user to input a new move. Castlings, default set ups and drawing figures are implemented here too.
    Author:
    Timon Borter

            javax.swing.JLabel givenLabelTimeTillEnd,
            javax.swing.JLabel givenLabelNamePlayer2,
            javax.swing.JFrame givenMainFrame)
        Starts a new game, this is not the GUI.
        Parameters:
        givenPlayerDatas - Requires PlayerDatas to check the steps
        givenFields - Requires fields to actualize the GUI in ChessBoard.java
        givenFigures - Requires figures to handle moves
        givenLabelNamePlayer1 - Requires label to show or hide
        givenLabelTimeTillEnd - Requires label to create the timer (Timer.java)
        givenLabelNamePlayer2 - Requires label to show or hide
